channel.title: Chromebook on Jacob Goldstein's Website

item.title: Install Linux with CHRX
item.description: Note: to do this, all your chromeOS data will be wiped. I recommend reading through all of this post before starting. This post is about how I got my chromebook dual booting galliumOS. Step one: go into Developer mode. Developer mode is a setting that lets you do development. It’s not on by default because it also makes it easier to install a malicious package. (APKs, or android packages, can’t be opened without developer mode.
